intro: Fagraea pyriformis, commonly known as the golden apple tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its elongated, ovate leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces fleshy, orange-colored fruits that are edible and contain a single seed. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical regions worldwide.
